boardgame.name: Titan
boardgame.description: This classic game of the Fantasy Monster Slug-a-thon is a standby from the The Avalon Hill Game Co of yore. The game still has a very devoted following, which is a tribute to the depth of the various strategies and approaches. The game is divided into two realms, the masterboard and the battleboards. On the masterboard, legions of mythical creatures roam about trying to recruit bigger and badder monsters and kill opposing legions in the process. When a combat occurs, the action moves to the corresponding battleboard type corresponding to the area the fight is taking place in. After lots of dice are tossed, the army that remains standing is returned to the masterboard with the spoils of war: points._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The points are used to recruit Angels and Archangels and to augment the leader character of the player's army: The Titan. As the points increase, the Titans become ever more powerful; at game end, the titan is able to kill most other character with a single blow. But be careful: If the Titan dies, the player is out of the game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The last Titan standing is the ruler of all, and winner of the game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Gently used. Excellent copy for playing. The game really is in good condition overall. Condition is actually in between Good and Acceptable. But just so you know exactly what you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re getting, here is a full description of the condition: Missing one non-crucial piece (one of the 12 red army cover-counters; the other five colors have all 12). Possibly also missing one or two creatures (email me for exact count of each creature type, if desired). I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ve played this several times (2-4 players) and never come close to running out of any counters. Everything else is complete and for the most part in very good condition: master gameboard, tactical combat terrain maps, dice, and rulebook. Dice are small d6, probably not original (original game apparently came with only four d6). Also includes two small plastic bins (not part of original game) that contain all the counters - these are handy to keep things organized (there are tons of counters in this game). Box is a little worn. There are a few blemishes on a couple terrain boards (see photo) and one box corner has tape on it. A small minority of the counters are very slightly darker than others, from use or age I imagine - I wouldn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t call this very noticeable. I have included a picture of what I believe to be the only imperfections of any significance – the couple small blotches on two tactical maps, and clear tape on one corner of the box. I have bought stuff online before, and I know how nice it is to know exactly what you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re getting. Unlike many ebay auctions that may just say _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Used_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; and show you a picture of the outer box, I have tried to give a complete and accurate description of this game_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s condition. Feel free to email me, and I will be happy to provide more photos or more details. I bought this copy used, about five years ago. My home is smoke, mold, and pet free. The game has no mildew smell or anything. This is my first time selling on BGG. But I have sold several things on ebay - my ebay user name is payson64. This is the original, self-published version of Titan from a production run of 500. The set has been played twice. The paper shows some foxing consistent with its age. One of the die has cracked. Will ship anywhere, but will need to work out shipping costs separately if outside USA.

AVALON HILL in MINT condition!!! I was a boardgame collector in the Eighties, but have not played in the last fifteen years. I never bought used items, I only bought them new in the shop. I have played TITAN (Bookcase Game by Avalon Hill) a few times (5-10) in the Eighties, but was very very carefully. All counters are there in separate boxes. Board, counters, rulebook and sheets are in absolutely MINT condition. The box would be perfect, like new, but on one bookcase-sideit has a light damage, but colour is NOT broken. Shipping: Germany 6 Euro. EU in Europe: 17 Euro. Rest of Europe: 30 Euro. USA, Canada: 35 Euro. Rest of the World: 40 Euro. International Paying per PayPal, in Europe and Germany bank transfer too - auch per Überweisung. Perfekt erhaltene Ausgabe von TITAN (Bookcase Game von Avalon Hill). mit allen Bestandteilen. Wurde von mir damals neu im Laden gekauft und auch beim Spielen (5-10mal) wie ein rohes Ei behandelt. Spielbrett, Counter (in kleinen Boxen geordnet), Rulebook und Sheets sind deshalb noch immer in Top-Zustand!!! Box sehr gut erhalten - wie neu, wäre da nicht eine leichte Delle an einer Bookcase-Seite, aber die Farbe ist noch intakt (wie minimale Risse im Lila der Box, bei denen man aber kaum Weiß wahrnimmt). Sonst alles, als wäre es eben NEU gekauft worden! Deutsche Übersetzung der Regeln liegt auch bei.

Titan is a full-out monster slug-a-thon, in which players must be prepared to sacrifice their creatures to cause maximum damage to their opponents. Players take the role of the Titan, and roam the board attempting to recruit bigger and badder monsters to fight for their legions. But just as your own army grows, your opponents themselves will be seeking the clash of battle, and there can be only one true Titan! Titan is played on a main gameboard, where armies are recruited, and positions set. When two armies meet, the action transfers to a battleboard, where the opposing forces battle for position and power. Only the strongest monsters will survive, bringing both points and glory to their Titan.
